cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 335 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north today, then recurving northeast toward the Florida Panhandle Wednesday, crossing the southeastern United States and emerging off the Mid-Atlantic coast Friday before accelerating into the North Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle/Big Bend near Panama City FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Fernandina Beach FL to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Alabama/Florida border to Suwannee River FL; Storm Surge Warning Okaloosa/Walton County Line FL to Anclote River FL; Tropical Storm Warning Alabama/Florida border to Chassahowitzka FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf Coast of Florida, then inland across GA/SC/NC and the Mid-Atlantic coastline before moving offshore New England
weather_observation.wind: Only a very low (≤3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions likely with gusts 25–35 kt during Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the New York / New Jersey harbor with current forecast track.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Friday into early Saturday as Michael’s remnants pass offshore, which may cause brief roadway ponding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas, rough surf and dangerous rip currents along the Jersey Shore and south shore of Long Island Friday–Saturday.
